card.title: NYC won't drop sanctuary status despite mayor saying 'no more room' for migrants

_source.content: NYC won't drop sanctuary status despite mayor saying 'no more room' for migrants ‚Äì [Adams called on the Biden administration for assistance] ‚Äì By Julia Musto:New York City Mayor Eric Adams said he would not consider suspending or stopping the Big Apple's sanctuary city policies amid the influx of migrants from the southern border. The Democrat told reporters on Tuesday that's "not on the agenda at all."  Adams said that New York has "no more room but we're still finding spaces and accommodating and we're going to continue to do that."  "That is our law, that is our obligation and that is what's morally right," he added. "We're going to do that." However, the mayor acknowledged the burden the influx of asylum seekers was having on the city and New Yorkers.  "It is unfair," Adams continued, "And, we're going to continue to take sure that we don't have families that are sleeping in the street because we did not do the best, we can to accommodate them." Finish Reading [ Video]: https://www.foxnews.com/politics/nyc-wont-drop-sanctuary-status-mayor-saying-no-more-room-migrants

NYC won't drop sanctuary status despite mayor saying 'no more room' for migrants ‚Äì [Adams called on the Biden administration for assistance] ‚Äì By Julia Musto:
New York City Mayor Eric Adams said he would not consider suspending or stopping the Big Apple's sanctuary city policies amid the influx of migrants from the southern border. The Democrat told reporters on Tuesday that's "not on the agenda at all." Adams said that New York has "no more room but we're still finding spaces and accommodating and we're going to continue to do that." "That is our law, that is our obligation and that is what's morally right," he added. "We're going to do that." However, the mayor acknowledged the burden the influx of asylum seekers was having on the city and New Yorkers. "It is unfair," Adams continued, "And, we're going to continue to take sure that we don't have families that are sleeping in the street because we did not do the best, we can to accommodate them." _source.content: NYC mayor visits border, fails to call out Biden: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has been raising complaints over the number of illegal aliens that have been flowing into his self-appointed "sanctuary city." Adams repeatedly laments that the Big Apple has "no more room" for an "unfair" influx of illegals, while at the same time stating that the city will uphold its "sanctuary" commitment because "that is our obligation and that is what's morally right." Ostensibly seeking a solution to this growing illegal immigration problem, Adams traveled to Texas to see the southern border for himself. Standing in El Paso, Texas ‚Äî which Joe Biden himself visited a week earlier ‚Äî Adams called the situation a "national crisis." However, rather than placing the blame for this crisis at the feet of Biden over his de facto open-border policies, Adams called for a more coordinated effort from FEMA to deal "with migrants and asylum seekers in our country." He also called for creation of a "national czar" to oversee this effort. Paging Kamala Harris. How about telling Biden to do his job and enforce U.S. border and immigration laws that are already on the books? In one sense, Adams was calling on the U.S. government to do something, but he was still unwilling to demand what needs to be done ‚Äî close the border to any and all illegal crossings.

_source.content: Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) and Paul Gosar (R-AZ) received committee assignments in the new Republican-controlled House after being kicked off committees by the Democrats in 2021.On Tuesday, the 30-member House Republican Steering Committee, consisting of House Leadership and elected regional representatives, selected Greene to sit on the Homeland Security Committee and Oversight Committees, in addition to Gosar being chosen to sit on the House Natural Resources and Oversight Committees, according to multiple reports.The Oversight Committee, chaired by Rep. James Comer (R-KY), and the Homeland Security Committee, chaired by Rep. Mark Green (R-TN), are expected to hold multiple investigations. Additionally, Greene has already called to impeach Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas over his poor border management.In November 2021, then-Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) pledged to put the two back on committees if Republicans won control of the House in the midterm elections, which they did.Shortly thereafter, in January 2022, McCarthy told Breitbart News‚Äôs Matthew Boyle, which he confirmed last week when speaking to reporters ‚Äî that he would strip Reps. Adam Schiff (D-CA), Eric Swalwell (D-CA), and Ilhan Omar (D-MN) of their respective committee seats in the 118th Congress.McCarthy indicated this would be due to Schiff using his role as the former chairman of the Intelligence Committee to perpetrate the Russia hoax, Swalwell for having a long-running affair with a woman the intelligence community identified as a Chinese spy named Fang Fang, and Omar for making numerous antisemitic comments and downplaying the Al Qaeda terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001.
_source.contentraw:
Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) and Paul Gosar (R-AZ) received committee assignments in the new Republican-controlled House after being kicked off committees by the Democrats in 2021.

On Tuesday, the 30-member House Republican Steering Committee, consisting of House Leadership and elected regional representatives, selected Greene to sit on the Homeland Security Committee and Oversight Committees, in addition to Gosar being chosen to sit on the House Natural Resources and Oversight Committees, according to multiple reports.

The Oversight Committee, chaired by Rep. James Comer (R-KY), and the Homeland Security Committee, chaired by Rep. Mark Green (R-TN), are expected to hold multiple investigations. Additionally, Greene has already called to impeach Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas over his poor border management.

In November 2021, then-Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) pledged to put the two back on committees if Republicans won control of the House in the midterm elections, which they did.

Shortly thereafter, in January 2022, McCarthy told Breitbart News‚Äôs Matthew Boyle, which he confirmed last week when speaking to reporters ‚Äî that he would strip Reps. Adam Schiff (D-CA), Eric Swalwell (D-CA), and Ilhan Omar (D-MN) of their respective committee seats in the 118th Congress.

McCarthy indicated this would be due to Schiff using his role as the former chairman of the Intelligence Committee to perpetrate the Russia hoax, Swalwell for having a long-running affair with a woman the intelligence community identified as a Chinese spy named Fang Fang, and Omar for making numerous antisemitic comments and downplaying the Al Qaeda terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001.

_source.contentraw:
BREAKING: Biden Admits He Kept No Visitor Logs In Home Where Classified Docs Were Found

Following the discovery of illegally stored classified and top secret documents in multiple locations, including his personal residence, President Joe Biden is now under a special counsel investigation.

Attorney General Merrick Garland appointed Robert Hur last week to be the special counsel that investigates the issue for the Department of Justice (DOJ).

As part of the US House‚Äôs oversight of the National Archives, the Oversight Committee has requested to see the visitor logs for Biden‚Äôs home in Wilmington, Delaware.

‚ÄúGiven the serious national security implications, the White House must provide the Wilmington residence‚Äôs visitor log,‚Äù House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer, R-Ky., wrote in a Sunday letter to White House chief of staff Ron Klain.

‚ÄúAs Chief of Staff, you are head of the Executive Office of the President and bear responsibility to be transparent with the American people on these important issues related to the White House‚Äôs handling of this matter,‚Äù Comer added.

Comer continued by insisting that in order to fully access the situation, the committee needs to know who may have been privy to the confidential information.

‚ÄúWithout a list of individuals who have visited his residence, the American people will never know who had access to these highly sensitive documents. The Committee demands transparency into whether any individuals with foreign connections to the Biden family gained access to President Biden‚Äôs residence and the classified documents that he has mishandled for years,‚Äù he wrote.

The White House Counsel‚Äôs Office replied to the request in a statement by saying no visitor logs exist.

_source.content: Security Guard Orders Man To Remove His Jesus Shirt, Said It Was ‚ÄòOffending‚Äô ShoppersIn what reminds me of the beginning stages of the silencing and persecution of dissenters in China during Chairman Mao‚Äôs revolution, a security guard was recorded telling a man wearing a ‚ÄúJesus Saves‚Äù T-shirt that his shirt is ‚Äúoffending‚Äù shoppers at the massive mall in Bloomington, Minnesota, ordering the man to remove the shirt or leave the mall.The confrontation took place at The Mall of America, Bloomington, MN, which has been criticized by conservatives for hosting and promoting a drag show for ‚Äúall ages‚Äù last year in its ‚Äúiconic rotunda.‚ÄùThe First Amendment of the Constitution prevents Congress from making laws respecting an establishment of religion or prohibiting its free exercise. It protects freedom of speech, the press, assembly, and the right to petition the Government for a redress of grievances.But, the same guaranteed free speech protections typically don‚Äôt apply in the private sector.Alpha News reported the confrontation that took place last weekend, citing videos published on social media.The outlet linked to a pair of clips showing the man talking with security guards near the mall‚Äôs rotunda, and Alpha News added that one of the videos was live-streamed on Jan. 7 to Facebook.The back of the man‚Äôs shirt reads ‚ÄúJesus is the only way‚Äù and includes the well-known ‚Äúcoexist‚Äù symbol crossed out‚Äù, the outlet said.‚ÄúJesus is associated with religion, and it‚Äôs offending people,‚Äù a security guard tells the man in one clip, adding that ‚Äúpeople have been offended.‚ÄùThe guard then aggressively tells the man to remove his shirt or leave the mall.‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt say anything, though,‚Äù the man replies. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt speak ‚Ä¶. I didn‚Äôt say anything. I just went to Macy‚Äôs.‚ÄùThe guard adds, ‚ÄúAgain ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm giving you a couple options: take the shirt off, and you can go to Macy‚Äôs, and you can do your shopping ‚Äî or you can leave the mall, OK? Those are your only options right now.‚ÄùIn the second part of the same clip, the guard gets increasingly frustrated telling the man, ‚ÄúIf you want to shop here, you need to take that shirt off!‚ÄùThe man asks what‚Äôs wrong with the shirt, and the guard replies ‚Äî with his voice still raised ‚Äî that ‚Äúit is religious soliciting; there is no soliciting allowed on mall property, which is private property!‚ÄùThe guard adds, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had guests come up saying that they‚Äôve been offended by your shirt ‚Ä¶ take the shirt off, and you can go shopping!‚Äùhttps://finishtherace.com/eric/security-guard-orders-man-to-remove-his-jesus-shirt-for-offending-shoppers/?utm_source=FTR%20Newsletter%201&utm_medium=email&utm_content=subscriber_id:46237536&utm_campaign=1673985602%20Biden%20Caught%20In%20Another%20Damning%20Scand...
_source.contentraw:
Security Guard Orders Man To Remove His Jesus Shirt, Said It Was ‚ÄòOffending‚Äô Shoppers

In what reminds me of the beginning stages of the silencing and persecution of dissenters in China during Chairman Mao‚Äôs revolution, a security guard was recorded telling a man wearing a ‚ÄúJesus Saves‚Äù T-shirt that his shirt is ‚Äúoffending‚Äù shoppers at the massive mall in Bloomington, Minnesota, ordering the man to remove the shirt or leave the mall.

The confrontation took place at The Mall of America, Bloomington, MN, which has been criticized by conservatives for hosting and promoting a drag show for ‚Äúall ages‚Äù last year in its ‚Äúiconic rotunda.‚Äù

The First Amendment of the Constitution prevents Congress from making laws respecting an establishment of religion or prohibiting its free exercise. It protects freedom of speech, the press, assembly, and the right to petition the Government for a redress of grievances.

But, the same guaranteed free speech protections typically don‚Äôt apply in the private sector.

Alpha News reported the confrontation that took place last weekend, citing videos published on social media.

The outlet linked to a pair of clips showing the man talking with security guards near the mall‚Äôs rotunda, and Alpha News added that one of the videos was live-streamed on Jan. 7 to Facebook.

The back of the man‚Äôs shirt reads ‚ÄúJesus is the only way‚Äù and includes the well-known ‚Äúcoexist‚Äù symbol crossed out‚Äù, the outlet said.

‚ÄúJesus is associated with religion, and it‚Äôs offending people,‚Äù a security guard tells the man in one clip, adding that ‚Äúpeople have been offended.‚Äù

The guard then aggressively tells the man to remove his shirt or leave the mall.

‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt say anything, though,‚Äù the man replies. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt speak ‚Ä¶. I didn‚Äôt say anything. I just went to Macy‚Äôs.‚Äù

The guard adds, ‚ÄúAgain ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm giving you a couple options: take the shirt off, and you can go to Macy‚Äôs, and you can do your shopping ‚Äî or you can leave the mall, OK? Those are your only options right now.‚Äù

In the second part of the same clip, the guard gets increasingly frustrated telling the man, ‚ÄúIf you want to shop here, you need to take that shirt off!‚Äù

The man asks what‚Äôs wrong with the shirt, and the guard replies ‚Äî with his voice still raised ‚Äî that ‚Äúit is religious soliciting; there is no soliciting allowed on mall property, which is private property!‚Äù

The guard adds, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve had guests come up saying that they‚Äôve been offended by your shirt ‚Ä¶ take the shirt off, and you can go shopping!‚Äù

_source.content: San Fran City Panel Urges Reparations Of $5 Million Per Black AdultChurch of Ben Klassenhttp://www.creativityreligion.com(ZH) In a spectacular display of what happens when woke politics intersects utter financial illiteracy, a San Francisco government advisory committee on reparations has recommended the city pay eligible black residents age 18 years and older $5 million apiece. That‚Äôs just the headline recommendation of the San Francisco African American Reparations Advisory Committee (AARAC), which was created by the city‚Äôs board of supervisors amid 2020‚Äôs nationwide racial tumult.Next on the wish list: ‚Äúa comprehensive debt forgiveness program that clears all educational, personal, credit card, payday loans, etc.‚Äù The group said this measure will get blacks out of ‚Äúan inescapable cycle of debt‚Äù so they can ‚Äúbuild wealth.‚ÄùRivaling the $5 million payment as an eyebrow-raiser, the committee also wants a welfare program that targets a $97,000 annual income for low-income blacks for the next 250 years. That‚Äôs right: a quarter-millennium of near-six-figure per capita handouts. ‚ÄúCenturies of harm and destruction of black lives, black bodies and black communities should be met with centuries of repair,‚Äù AARAC chair Eric McDonnell told the San Francisco Chronicle.As with every leftist agenda item, this one demonstrates a profound obliviousness to the influence of incentives on individual human action: There‚Äôs no surer way of guaranteeing an individual will stay ‚Äúlow-income‚Äù than promising to round them up to $97,000.But wait ‚Äî there‚Äôs more: Those who qualify for reparations should also receive payroll tax, business tax and property tax credits, the panel says.The city should also ‚Äúcreate structures and pathways to mitigate tax consequences for recipients of reparations funds.‚Äù Sounds like the board of supervisors will get to take a fact-finding trip to the Cayman Islands.Never mind that California wasn‚Äôt a slave state, says the committee:    ‚ÄúWhile neither San Francisco, nor California, formally adopted the institution of chattel slavery, the values of segregation, white supremacy and systematic repression and exclusion of Black people were legally codified and enforced.‚ÄùThe Chronicle approvingly called it a ‚Äúbold‚Äù plan, and said ‚Äúwhat happens next will show whether San Francisco politicians are serious about confronting the city‚Äôs checkered past.‚ÄùStephen Williams at November‚Äôs ‚ÄúRally 4 Reparations‚Äù in Washington DC (Dee Dwyer for NPR)To its credit, the committee seems wary of a new California gold rush comprised of opportunistic reparations prospectors. To guard against a wave of black migrants cashing in, AARAC took a stab at incorporating time-in-residency prerequisites.Their fiscal border wall, however, has big gaps. Their list of criteria applies a ‚Äúmust meet at least two‚Äù approach, making it easier for new San Franciscans to sidestep the length-of-residency rules. For example, if you‚Äôre a descendant of a slave, and you were personally or a direct descendant of someone incarcerated for breaking drug laws, you‚Äôre in.In a blow to the woke pillar of creative and flexible identity, AARAC shamefully stipulates that all applicants should have ‚Äúidentified‚Äù as ‚Äúblack/African American‚Äù for at least 10 years. Let‚Äôs just hope there‚Äôs no need for photo ID.Financial acumen appears to be in short supply among the AARAC members. San Francisco‚Äôs budget is around $14 billion and there were about 47,000 African Americans in the 2020 census. If just 10,000 residents qualify, the $5 million payment alone would cost $50 billion. Diversity isn‚Äôt a strength of the reparations committee either: All 14 members are black. However, there‚Äôs a vacant seat right now ‚Äî available only to ‚Äúan individual who has lived or is currently living in public housing.‚ÄùThis article originally appeared on Zero Hedge.

(ZH) In a spectacular display of what happens when woke politics intersects utter financial illiteracy, a San Francisco government advisory committee on reparations has recommended the city pay eligible black residents age 18 years and older $5 million apiece. 

That‚Äôs just the headline recommendation of the San Francisco African American Reparations Advisory Committee (AARAC), which was created by the city‚Äôs board of supervisors amid 2020‚Äôs nationwide racial tumult.

Next on the wish list: ‚Äúa comprehensive debt forgiveness program that clears all educational, personal, credit card, payday loans, etc.‚Äù The group said this measure will get blacks out of ‚Äúan inescapable cycle of debt‚Äù so they can ‚Äúbuild wealth.‚Äù

Rivaling the $5 million payment as an eyebrow-raiser, the committee also wants a welfare program that targets a $97,000 annual income for low-income blacks for the next 250 years. 

That‚Äôs right: a quarter-millennium of near-six-figure per capita handouts. ‚ÄúCenturies of harm and destruction of black lives, black bodies and black communities should be met with centuries of repair,‚Äù AARAC chair Eric McDonnell told the San Francisco Chronicle.

As with every leftist agenda item, this one demonstrates a profound obliviousness to the influence of incentives on individual human action: There‚Äôs no surer way of guaranteeing an individual will stay ‚Äúlow-income‚Äù than promising to round them up to $97,000.

But wait ‚Äî there‚Äôs more: Those who qualify for reparations should also receive payroll tax, business tax and property tax credits, the panel says.

The city should also ‚Äúcreate structures and pathways to mitigate tax consequences for recipients of reparations funds.‚Äù Sounds like the board of supervisors will get to take a fact-finding trip to the Cayman Islands.

Never mind that California wasn‚Äôt a slave state, says the committee:

‚ÄúWhile neither San Francisco, nor California, formally adopted the institution of chattel slavery, the values of segregation, white supremacy and systematic repression and exclusion of Black people were legally codified and enforced.‚Äù

The Chronicle approvingly called it a ‚Äúbold‚Äù plan, and said ‚Äúwhat happens next will show whether San Francisco politicians are serious about confronting the city‚Äôs checkered past.‚Äù

Stephen Williams at November‚Äôs ‚ÄúRally 4 Reparations‚Äù in Washington DC (Dee Dwyer for NPR)

To its credit, the committee seems wary of a new California gold rush comprised of opportunistic reparations prospectors. To guard against a wave of black migrants cashing in, AARAC took a stab at incorporating time-in-residency prerequisites.

Their fiscal border wall, however, has big gaps. Their list of criteria applies a ‚Äúmust meet at least two‚Äù approach, making it easier for new San Franciscans to sidestep the length-of-residency rules. For example, if you‚Äôre a descendant of a slave, and you were personally or a direct descendant of someone incarcerated for breaking drug laws, you‚Äôre in.

In a blow to the woke pillar of creative and flexible identity, AARAC shamefully stipulates that all applicants should have ‚Äúidentified‚Äù as ‚Äúblack/African American‚Äù for at least 10 years. Let‚Äôs just hope there‚Äôs no need for photo ID.

Financial acumen appears to be in short supply among the AARAC members. San Francisco‚Äôs budget is around $14 billion and there were about 47,000 African Americans in the 2020 census. If just 10,000 residents qualify, the $5 million payment alone would cost $50 billion. 

Diversity isn‚Äôt a strength of the reparations committee either: All 14 members are black. However, there‚Äôs a vacant seat right now ‚Äî available only to ‚Äúan individual who has lived or is currently living in public housing.‚Äù

This article originally appeared on Zero Hedge.

_source.contentraw:
San Fran City Panel Urges Reparations Of $5 Million Per Black Adult


Church of Ben Klassen
http://www.creativityreligion.com


(ZH) In a spectacular display of what happens when woke politics intersects utter financial illiteracy, a San Francisco government advisory committee on reparations has recommended the city pay eligible black residents age 18 years and older $5 million apiece. 

That‚Äôs just the headline recommendation of the San Francisco African American Reparations Advisory Committee (AARAC), which was created by the city‚Äôs board of supervisors amid 2020‚Äôs nationwide racial tumult.

Next on the wish list: ‚Äúa comprehensive debt forgiveness program that clears all educational, personal, credit card, payday loans, etc.‚Äù The group said this measure will get blacks out of ‚Äúan inescapable cycle of debt‚Äù so they can ‚Äúbuild wealth.‚Äù

Rivaling the $5 million payment as an eyebrow-raiser, the committee also wants a welfare program that targets a $97,000 annual income for low-income blacks for the next 250 years. 

That‚Äôs right: a quarter-millennium of near-six-figure per capita handouts. ‚ÄúCenturies of harm and destruction of black lives, black bodies and black communities should be met with centuries of repair,‚Äù AARAC chair Eric McDonnell told the San Francisco Chronicle.

As with every leftist agenda item, this one demonstrates a profound obliviousness to the influence of incentives on individual human action: There‚Äôs no surer way of guaranteeing an individual will stay ‚Äúlow-income‚Äù than promising to round them up to $97,000.

But wait ‚Äî there‚Äôs more: Those who qualify for reparations should also receive payroll tax, business tax and property tax credits, the panel says.

The city should also ‚Äúcreate structures and pathways to mitigate tax consequences for recipients of reparations funds.‚Äù Sounds like the board of supervisors will get to take a fact-finding trip to the Cayman Islands.

Never mind that California wasn‚Äôt a slave state, says the committee:

‚ÄúWhile neither San Francisco, nor California, formally adopted the institution of chattel slavery, the values of segregation, white supremacy and systematic repression and exclusion of Black people were legally codified and enforced.‚Äù

The Chronicle approvingly called it a ‚Äúbold‚Äù plan, and said ‚Äúwhat happens next will show whether San Francisco politicians are serious about confronting the city‚Äôs checkered past.‚Äù

Stephen Williams at November‚Äôs ‚ÄúRally 4 Reparations‚Äù in Washington DC (Dee Dwyer for NPR)

To its credit, the committee seems wary of a new California gold rush comprised of opportunistic reparations prospectors. To guard against a wave of black migrants cashing in, AARAC took a stab at incorporating time-in-residency prerequisites.

Their fiscal border wall, however, has big gaps. Their list of criteria applies a ‚Äúmust meet at least two‚Äù approach, making it easier for new San Franciscans to sidestep the length-of-residency rules. For example, if you‚Äôre a descendant of a slave, and you were personally or a direct descendant of someone incarcerated for breaking drug laws, you‚Äôre in.

In a blow to the woke pillar of creative and flexible identity, AARAC shamefully stipulates that all applicants should have ‚Äúidentified‚Äù as ‚Äúblack/African American‚Äù for at least 10 years. Let‚Äôs just hope there‚Äôs no need for photo ID.

Financial acumen appears to be in short supply among the AARAC members. San Francisco‚Äôs budget is around $14 billion and there were about 47,000 African Americans in the 2020 census. If just 10,000 residents qualify, the $5 million payment alone would cost $50 billion. 

Diversity isn‚Äôt a strength of the reparations committee either: All 14 members are black. However, there‚Äôs a vacant seat right now ‚Äî available only to ‚Äúan individual who has lived or is currently living in public housing.‚Äù

This article originally appeared on Zero Hedge.

Blacktivists Demand Good Samaritan Be Charged for Shooting Black Thug who Robbed Houston Taco Joint

Church of Ben Klassen
http://www.creativityreligion.com

COBK NOTE : White people need to start adopting the same mentality that the niggers and spics have and treat the pigs, society, stores, and the system with the exact same attitudes, or else we will lose!! Steal from stores, ----- pigs, look at prison as a badge of honour, and whenever someone gets in your face just ---- them. Hell, our leader did 12 years. He's got balls. Grow some balls, White Man, and be the evil criminals we are treated as by society!!

By Chris Menahan

A group of race hustlers organized a press conference on Sunday to demand the Good Samaritan who shot and killed an armed robber at a Houston taco joint earlier this month face criminal charges.

WATCH:

From KHOU, ‚ÄúHouston activists say ‚Äòvigilante killer‚Äô who shot robbery suspect should be charged‚Äù:

Several community activists gathered Sunday at the southwest Houston taqueria at which a robber was shot and killed earlier this month.

They said the shooting went ‚Äúbeyond self-defense‚Äù and also characterized it as ‚Äúa cold-blooded execution.‚Äù

While some are calling him a hero, this group wants the shooter to be criminally indicted.

‚ÄúWe must not allow citizens to become judge, jury and executor,‚Äù the group, which consisted of Dr. Candice Matthews (Texas Coalition of Black Democrats/Rainbow/PUSH Coalition/New Black Panther Nation), Quanell X (New Black Panther Nation), family members of the deceased and other civil rights organizations, said in a statement.

The Rainbow PU$H Coalition is Jesse Jackson‚Äôs group.

They use a $ for an S because they‚Äôre all about the Hu$tle.

Quanell X said the group is not condoning the actions of 30-year-old Eric Eugene Washington and said he was wrong for robbing the store. They said he deserved to be punished and sent to jail ‚Äî but not killed.

‚ÄúHe went too far,‚Äù Quanell X said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs overkill. That‚Äôs no longer self-defense.‚Äù

They‚Äôre calling for the shooter to be charged with something. Quanell X said he‚Äôs not sure what that charge should be.

‚ÄúThat man went from being a law-abiding citizen to now committing criminal acts and criminal crimes. We believe ‚Ä¶ I believe that he should be charged with something because we cannot have a society where our citizens are judge, jury and executioner,‚Äù Quanell X said.

The group said they don‚Äôt believe the initial shots were a problem.

‚ÄúHe stood over the young man and shot him multiple times over and over again when he was no longer a threat,‚Äù Quanell X said. ‚ÄúI know for a fact that this was not just a simple act of a good citizen defending himself. There was no justification to walk up on him and put multiple shots, then leave with the weapon and come back and shoot him in the head again. That‚Äôs too much.‚Äù

Matthews told the exact same lie.

‚ÄúHe turned around, he shot the man, took the gun, put it on the counter, then came back, shot him repeatedly, and then turned around and shot him execution style and then walked off,‚Äù Matthews said.

The video shows he shot the man a split second after taking his gun away. It was all in one motion. He didn‚Äôt put the gun down on a table and then return to ‚Äúexecute‚Äù him.

Cont. http://pic.twitter.com/cIEynn2cyg

‚Äî Gage ‚ôäÔ∏è (@Mr12G) January 7, 2023

Houston criminal defense attorney Sean Buckley said last week that the Good Samaritan‚Äôs actions were entirely justified and noted how in Houston armed robbers often ‚Äúshoot people indiscriminately and for no reason at all‚Äù after robbing them.

Houston Police released a video of one such robbery on Friday showing a thug shoot a clerk in the chest just for kicks before leaving:

We need your help to identify a robbery suspect who shot a cooperative store clerk in the chest at a convenience store at 6955 Griggs on Dec. 16. If you have info about this suspect, please call @CrimeStopHOU at 713-222-TIPS. @houstonpolice

Full store at https://t.co/eJba6a65Qx http://pic.twitter.com/WEWaSlYki2

‚Äî Houston Police Robbery (@hpdrobbery) January 13, 2023

If the clerk pulled out a gun and shot that thug while he had his back turned for a split second we‚Äôd be hearing the same nonsense about an ‚Äúexecution-style‚Äù shooting of someone who was ‚Äúleaving.‚Äù

As I noted last week, this case never should have been sent to a grand jury because clowns like this will side with the criminal regardless of the facts in the name of racial solidarity.

Blacktivists Demand Good Samaritan Be Charged for Shooting Black Thug who Robbed Houston Taco Joint

Church of Ben Klassen
http://www.creativityreligion.com

COBK NOTE : White people need to start adopting the same mentality that the niggers and spics have and treat the pigs, society, stores, and the system with the exact same attitudes, or else we will lose!! Steal from stores, ----- pigs, look at prison as a badge of honour, and whenever someone gets in your face just ---- them. Hell, our leader did 12 years. He's got balls. Grow some balls, White Man, and be the evil criminals we are treated as by society!!

By Chris Menahan

A group of race hustlers organized a press conference on Sunday to demand the Good Samaritan who shot and killed an armed robber at a Houston taco joint earlier this month face criminal charges.

WATCH:

From KHOU, ‚ÄúHouston activists say ‚Äòvigilante killer‚Äô who shot robbery suspect should be charged‚Äù:

Several community activists gathered Sunday at the southwest Houston taqueria at which a robber was shot and killed earlier this month.

They said the shooting went ‚Äúbeyond self-defense‚Äù and also characterized it as ‚Äúa cold-blooded execution.‚Äù

While some are calling him a hero, this group wants the shooter to be criminally indicted.

‚ÄúWe must not allow citizens to become judge, jury and executor,‚Äù the group, which consisted of Dr. Candice Matthews (Texas Coalition of Black Democrats/Rainbow/PUSH Coalition/New Black Panther Nation), Quanell X (New Black Panther Nation), family members of the deceased and other civil rights organizations, said in a statement.

The Rainbow PU$H Coalition is Jesse Jackson‚Äôs group.

They use a $ for an S because they‚Äôre all about the Hu$tle.

Quanell X said the group is not condoning the actions of 30-year-old Eric Eugene Washington and said he was wrong for robbing the store. They said he deserved to be punished and sent to jail ‚Äî but not killed.

‚ÄúHe went too far,‚Äù Quanell X said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs overkill. That‚Äôs no longer self-defense.‚Äù

They‚Äôre calling for the shooter to be charged with something. Quanell X said he‚Äôs not sure what that charge should be.

‚ÄúThat man went from being a law-abiding citizen to now committing criminal acts and criminal crimes. We believe ‚Ä¶ I believe that he should be charged with something because we cannot have a society where our citizens are judge, jury and executioner,‚Äù Quanell X said.

The group said they don‚Äôt believe the initial shots were a problem.

‚ÄúHe stood over the young man and shot him multiple times over and over again when he was no longer a threat,‚Äù Quanell X said. ‚ÄúI know for a fact that this was not just a simple act of a good citizen defending himself. There was no justification to walk up on him and put multiple shots, then leave with the weapon and come back and shoot him in the head again. That‚Äôs too much.‚Äù

Matthews told the exact same lie.

‚ÄúHe turned around, he shot the man, took the gun, put it on the counter, then came back, shot him repeatedly, and then turned around and shot him execution style and then walked off,‚Äù Matthews said.

The video shows he shot the man a split second after taking his gun away. It was all in one motion. He didn‚Äôt put the gun down on a table and then return to ‚Äúexecute‚Äù him.

Cont. http://pic.twitter.com/cIEynn2cyg

‚Äî Gage ‚ôäÔ∏è (@Mr12G) January 7, 2023

Houston criminal defense attorney Sean Buckley said last week that the Good Samaritan‚Äôs actions were entirely justified and noted how in Houston armed robbers often ‚Äúshoot people indiscriminately and for no reason at all‚Äù after robbing them.

Houston Police released a video of one such robbery on Friday showing a thug shoot a clerk in the chest just for kicks before leaving:

We need your help to identify a robbery suspect who shot a cooperative store clerk in the chest at a convenience store at 6955 Griggs on Dec. 16. If you have info about this suspect, please call @CrimeStopHOU at 713-222-TIPS. @houstonpolice

Full store at https://t.co/eJba6a65Qx http://pic.twitter.com/WEWaSlYki2

‚Äî Houston Police Robbery (@hpdrobbery) January 13, 2023

If the clerk pulled out a gun and shot that thug while he had his back turned for a split second we‚Äôd be hearing the same nonsense about an ‚Äúexecution-style‚Äù shooting of someone who was ‚Äúleaving.‚Äù

As I noted last week, this case never should have been sent to a grand jury because clowns like this will side with the criminal regardless of the facts in the name of racial solidarity.

Blacktivists Demand Good Samaritan Be Charged for Shooting Black Thug who Robbed Houston Taco Joint

Church of Ben Klassen
http://www.creativityreligion.com

COBK NOTE : White people need to start adopting the same mentality that the niggers and spics have and treat the pigs, society, stores, and the system with the exact same attitudes, or else we will lose!! Steal from stores, ----- pigs, look at prison as a badge of honour, and whenever someone gets in your face just ---- them. Hell, our leader did 12 years. He's got balls. Grow some balls, White Man, and be the evil criminals we are treated as by society!!

By Chris Menahan

A group of race hustlers organized a press conference on Sunday to demand the Good Samaritan who shot and killed an armed robber at a Houston taco joint earlier this month face criminal charges.

WATCH:

From KHOU, ‚ÄúHouston activists say ‚Äòvigilante killer‚Äô who shot robbery suspect should be charged‚Äù:

Several community activists gathered Sunday at the southwest Houston taqueria at which a robber was shot and killed earlier this month.

They said the shooting went ‚Äúbeyond self-defense‚Äù and also characterized it as ‚Äúa cold-blooded execution.‚Äù

While some are calling him a hero, this group wants the shooter to be criminally indicted.

‚ÄúWe must not allow citizens to become judge, jury and executor,‚Äù the group, which consisted of Dr. Candice Matthews (Texas Coalition of Black Democrats/Rainbow/PUSH Coalition/New Black Panther Nation), Quanell X (New Black Panther Nation), family members of the deceased and other civil rights organizations, said in a statement.

The Rainbow PU$H Coalition is Jesse Jackson‚Äôs group.

They use a $ for an S because they‚Äôre all about the Hu$tle.

Quanell X said the group is not condoning the actions of 30-year-old Eric Eugene Washington and said he was wrong for robbing the store. They said he deserved to be punished and sent to jail ‚Äî but not killed.

‚ÄúHe went too far,‚Äù Quanell X said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs overkill. That‚Äôs no longer self-defense.‚Äù

They‚Äôre calling for the shooter to be charged with something. Quanell X said he‚Äôs not sure what that charge should be.

‚ÄúThat man went from being a law-abiding citizen to now committing criminal acts and criminal crimes. We believe ‚Ä¶ I believe that he should be charged with something because we cannot have a society where our citizens are judge, jury and executioner,‚Äù Quanell X said.

The group said they don‚Äôt believe the initial shots were a problem.

‚ÄúHe stood over the young man and shot him multiple times over and over again when he was no longer a threat,‚Äù Quanell X said. ‚ÄúI know for a fact that this was not just a simple act of a good citizen defending himself. There was no justification to walk up on him and put multiple shots, then leave with the weapon and come back and shoot him in the head again. That‚Äôs too much.‚Äù

Matthews told the exact same lie.

‚ÄúHe turned around, he shot the man, took the gun, put it on the counter, then came back, shot him repeatedly, and then turned around and shot him execution style and then walked off,‚Äù Matthews said.

The video shows he shot the man a split second after taking his gun away. It was all in one motion. He didn‚Äôt put the gun down on a table and then return to ‚Äúexecute‚Äù him.

Cont. http://pic.twitter.com/cIEynn2cyg

‚Äî Gage ‚ôäÔ∏è (@Mr12G) January 7, 2023

Houston criminal defense attorney Sean Buckley said last week that the Good Samaritan‚Äôs actions were entirely justified and noted how in Houston armed robbers often ‚Äúshoot people indiscriminately and for no reason at all‚Äù after robbing them.

Houston Police released a video of one such robbery on Friday showing a thug shoot a clerk in the chest just for kicks before leaving:

We need your help to identify a robbery suspect who shot a cooperative store clerk in the chest at a convenience store at 6955 Griggs on Dec. 16. If you have info about this suspect, please call @CrimeStopHOU at 713-222-TIPS. @houstonpolice

Full store at https://t.co/eJba6a65Qx http://pic.twitter.com/WEWaSlYki2

‚Äî Houston Police Robbery (@hpdrobbery) January 13, 2023

If the clerk pulled out a gun and shot that thug while he had his back turned for a split second we‚Äôd be hearing the same nonsense about an ‚Äúexecution-style‚Äù shooting of someone who was ‚Äúleaving.‚Äù

As I noted last week, this case never should have been sent to a grand jury because clowns like this will side with the criminal regardless of the facts in the name of racial solidarity.
